00031 #define DEBUG_SUBSYSTEM S_LQUOTA

00038 typedef int (enqi_bl_cb_t)(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
00039                            struct ldlm_lock_desc *desc, void *data,
00040                            int flag);
00041 static enqi_bl_cb_t qsd_glb_blocking_ast, qsd_id_blocking_ast;
00042 
00043 typedef int (enqi_gl_cb_t)(struct ldlm_lock *lock, void *data);
00044 static enqi_gl_cb_t qsd_glb_glimpse_ast, qsd_id_glimpse_ast;

00046 struct ldlm_enqueue_info qsd_glb_einfo = {
00047         .ei_type        = LDLM_PLAIN,
00048         .ei_mode        = LCK_CR,
00049         .ei_cb_bl       = qsd_glb_blocking_ast,
00050         .ei_cb_cp       = ldlm_completion_ast,
00051         .ei_cb_gl       = qsd_glb_glimpse_ast,
00052 };
00053 
00054 struct ldlm_enqueue_info qsd_id_einfo = {
00055         .ei_type        = LDLM_PLAIN,
00056         .ei_mode        = LCK_CR,
00057         .ei_cb_bl       = qsd_id_blocking_ast,
00058         .ei_cb_cp       = ldlm_completion_ast,
00059         .ei_cb_gl       = qsd_id_glimpse_ast,
00060 };
00061 
00062 /*
00063  * Return qsd_qtype_info structure associated with a global lock
00064  *
00065  * \param lock - is the global lock from which we should extract the qqi
00066  * \param reset - whether lock->l_ast_data should be cleared
00067  */
00068 static struct qsd_qtype_info *qsd_glb_ast_data_get(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
00069                                                    bool reset) {
00070         struct qsd_qtype_info *qqi;
00071         ENTRY;
00072 
00073         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00074         qqi = lock->l_ast_data;
00075         if (qqi != NULL) {
00076                 qqi_getref(qqi);
00077                 if (reset)
00078                         lock->l_ast_data = NULL;
00079         }
00080         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00081 
00082         if (qqi != NULL)
00083                 /* it is not safe to call lu_ref_add() under spinlock */
00084                 lu_ref_add(&qqi->qqi_reference, "ast_data_get", lock);
00085 
00086         if (reset && qqi != NULL) {
00087                 /* release qqi reference hold for the lock */
00088                 lu_ref_del(&qqi->qqi_reference, "glb_lock", lock);
00089                 qqi_putref(qqi);
00090         }
00091         RETURN(qqi);
00092 }
00093 
00094 /*
00095  * Return lquota entry structure associated with a per-ID lock
00096  *
00097  * \param lock - is the per-ID lock from which we should extract the lquota
00098  *               entry
00099  * \param reset - whether lock->l_ast_data should be cleared
00100  */
00101 static struct lquota_entry *qsd_id_ast_data_get(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
00102                                                 bool reset) {
00103         struct lquota_entry *lqe;
00104         ENTRY;
00105 
00106         lock_res_and_lock(lock);
00107         lqe = lock->l_ast_data;
00108         if (lqe != NULL) {
00109                 lqe_getref(lqe);
00110                 if (reset)
00111                         lock->l_ast_data = NULL;
00112         }
00113         unlock_res_and_lock(lock);
00114 
00115         if (reset && lqe != NULL)
00116                 /* release lqe reference hold for the lock */
00117                 lqe_putref(lqe);
00118         RETURN(lqe);
00119 }
00120 
00121 /*
00122  * Glimpse callback handler for all quota locks. This function extracts
00123  * information from the glimpse request.
00124  *
00125  * \param lock - is the lock targeted by the glimpse
00126  * \param data - is a pointer to the glimpse ptlrpc request
00127  * \param req  - is the glimpse request
00128  * \param desc - is the glimpse descriptor describing the purpose of the glimpse
00129  *               request.
00130  * \param lvb  - is the pointer to the lvb in the reply buffer
00131  *
00132  * \retval 0 on success and \desc, \lvb & \arg point to a valid structures,
00133  *         appropriate error on failure
00134  */
00135 static int qsd_common_glimpse_ast(struct ptlrpc_request *req,
00136                                   struct ldlm_gl_lquota_desc **desc, void **lvb)
00137 {
00138         int rc;
00139         ENTRY;
00140 
00141         LASSERT(lustre_msg_get_opc(req->rq_reqmsg) == LDLM_GL_CALLBACK);
00142 
00143         /* glimpse on quota locks always packs a glimpse descriptor */
00144         req_capsule_extend(&req->rq_pill, &RQF_LDLM_GL_DESC_CALLBACK);
00145 
00146         /* extract glimpse descriptor */
00147         *desc = req_capsule_client_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_GL_DESC);
00148         if (*desc == NULL)
00149                 RETURN(-EFAULT);
00150 
00151         /* prepare reply */
00152         req_capsule_set_size(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB, RCL_SERVER,
00153                              sizeof(struct lquota_lvb));
00154         rc = req_capsule_server_pack(&req->rq_pill);
00155         if (rc != 0) {
00156                 CERROR("Can't pack response, rc %d\n", rc);
00157                 RETURN(rc);
00158         }
00159 
00160         /* extract lvb */
00161         *lvb = req_capsule_server_get(&req->rq_pill, &RMF_DLM_LVB);
00162 
00163         RETURN(0);
00164 }
00165 
00166 /*
00167  * Blocking callback handler for global index lock
00168  *
00169  * \param lock - is the lock for which ast occurred.
00170  * \param desc - is the description of a conflicting lock in case of blocking
00171  *               ast.
00172  * \param data - is the value of lock->l_ast_data
00173  * \param flag - LDLM_CB_BLOCKING or LDLM_CB_CANCELING. Used to distinguish
00174  *               cancellation and blocking ast's.
00175  */
00176 static int qsd_glb_blocking_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock,
00177                                 struct ldlm_lock_desc *desc, void *data,
00178                                 int flag)
00179 {
00180         int rc = 0;
00181         ENTRY;
00182 
00183         switch(flag) {
00184         case LDLM_CB_BLOCKING: {
00185                 struct lustre_handle lockh;
00186 
00187                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "blocking AST on global quota lock");
00188                 ldlm_lock2handle(lock, &lockh);
00189                 rc = ldlm_cli_cancel(&lockh, LCF_ASYNC);
00190                 break;
00191         }
00192         case LDLM_CB_CANCELING: {
00193                 struct qsd_qtype_info *qqi;
00194 
00195                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "canceling global quota lock");
00196 
00197                 qqi = qsd_glb_ast_data_get(lock, true);
00198                 if (qqi == NULL)
00199                         break;
00200 
00201                 /* we are losing the global index lock, so let's mark the
00202                  * global & slave indexes as not up-to-date any more */
00203                 write_lock(&qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_lock);
00204                 qqi->qqi_glb_uptodate = false;
00205                 qqi->qqi_slv_uptodate = false;
00206                 if (lock->l_handle.h_cookie == qqi->qqi_lockh.cookie)
00207                         memset(&qqi->qqi_lockh, 0, sizeof(qqi->qqi_lockh));
00208                 write_unlock(&qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_lock);
00209 
00210                 CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "%s: losing global index lock for %s type\n",
00211                        qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_svname, QTYPE_NAME((qqi->qqi_qtype)));
00212 
00213                 /* kick off reintegration thread if not running already, if
00214                  * it's just local cancel (for stack clean up or eviction),
00215                  * don't re-trigger the reintegration. */
00216                 if (!ldlm_is_local_only(lock))
00217                         qsd_start_reint_thread(qqi);
00218 
00219                 lu_ref_del(&qqi->qqi_reference, "ast_data_get", lock);
00220                 qqi_putref(qqi);
00221                 break;
00222         }
00223         default:
00224                 LASSERTF(0, "invalid flags for blocking ast %d\n", flag);
00225         }
00226 
00227         RETURN(rc);
00228 }
00229 
00230 /*
00231  * Glimpse callback handler for global quota lock.
00232  *
00233  * \param lock - is the lock targeted by the glimpse
00234  * \param data - is a pointer to the glimpse ptlrpc request
00235  */
00236 static int qsd_glb_glimpse_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, void *data)
00237 {
00238         struct ptlrpc_request           *req = data;
00239         struct qsd_qtype_info           *qqi;
00240         struct ldlm_gl_lquota_desc      *desc;
00241         struct lquota_lvb               *lvb;
00242         struct lquota_glb_rec            rec;
00243         int                              rc;
00244         ENTRY;
00245 
00246         rc = qsd_common_glimpse_ast(req, &desc, (void **)&lvb);
00247         if (rc)
00248                 GOTO(out, rc);
00249 
00250         qqi = qsd_glb_ast_data_get(lock, false);
00251         if (qqi == NULL)
00252                 /* valid race */
00253                 GOTO(out, rc = -ELDLM_NO_LOCK_DATA);
00254 
00255         CDEBUG(D_QUOTA, "%s: glimpse on glb quota locks, id:"LPU64" ver:"LPU64
00256                " hard:" LPU64" soft:"LPU64"\n", qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_svname,
00257                desc->gl_id.qid_uid, desc->gl_ver, desc->gl_hardlimit,
00258                desc->gl_softlimit);
00259 
00260         if (desc->gl_ver == 0) {
00261                 CERROR("%s: invalid global index version "LPU64"\n",
00262                        qqi->qqi_qsd->qsd_svname, desc->gl_ver);
00263                 GOTO(out_qqi, rc = -EINVAL);
00264         }
00265 
00266         /* extract new hard & soft limits from the glimpse descriptor */
00267         rec.qbr_hardlimit = desc->gl_hardlimit;
00268         rec.qbr_softlimit = desc->gl_softlimit;
00269         rec.qbr_time      = desc->gl_time;
00270         rec.qbr_granted   = 0;
00271 
00272         /* We can't afford disk io in the context of glimpse callback handling
00273          * thread, so the on-disk global limits update has to be deferred. */
00274         qsd_upd_schedule(qqi, NULL, &desc->gl_id, (union lquota_rec *)&rec,
00275                          desc->gl_ver, true);
00276         EXIT;
00277 out_qqi:
00278         lu_ref_del(&qqi->qqi_reference, "ast_data_get", lock);
00279         qqi_putref(qqi);
00280 out:
00281         req->rq_status = rc;
00282         return rc;
00283 }
00284 
00295 static int qsd_id_blocking_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, struct ldlm_lock_desc *desc,
00296                                void *data, int flag)
00297 {
00298         struct lustre_handle    lockh;
00299         int                     rc = 0;
00300         ENTRY;
00301 
00302         switch(flag) {
00303         case LDLM_CB_BLOCKING: {
00304 
00305                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "blocking AST on ID quota lock");
00306                 ldlm_lock2handle(lock, &lockh);
00307                 rc = ldlm_cli_cancel(&lockh, LCF_ASYNC);
00308                 break;
00309         }
00310         case LDLM_CB_CANCELING: {
00311                 struct lu_env           *env;
00312                 struct lquota_entry     *lqe;
00313 
00314                 LDLM_DEBUG(lock, "canceling ID quota lock");
00315                 lqe = qsd_id_ast_data_get(lock, true);
00316                 if (lqe == NULL)
00317                         break;
00318 
00319                 LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "losing ID lock");
00320 
00321                 ldlm_lock2handle(lock, &lockh);
00322                 lqe_write_lock(lqe);
00323                 if (lustre_handle_equal(&lockh, &lqe->lqe_lockh)) {
00324                         /* Clear lqe_lockh & reset qunit to 0 */
00325                         qsd_set_qunit(lqe, 0);
00326                         memset(&lqe->lqe_lockh, 0, sizeof(lqe->lqe_lockh));
00327                         qsd_set_edquot(lqe, false);
00328                 }
00329                 lqe_write_unlock(lqe);
00330 
00331                 /* If there is dqacq inflight, the release will be skipped
00332                  * at this time, and triggered on dqacq completion later,
00333                  * which means there could be a short window that slave is
00334                  * holding spare grant wihtout per-ID lock. */
00335 
00336                 /* don't release quota space for local cancel (stack clean
00337                  * up or eviction) */
00338                 if (!ldlm_is_local_only(lock)) {
00339                         /* allocate environment */
00340                         OBD_ALLOC_PTR(env);
00341                         if (env == NULL) {
00342                                 lqe_putref(lqe);
00343                                 rc = -ENOMEM;
00344                                 break;
00345                         }
00346 
00347                         /* initialize environment */
00348                         rc = lu_env_init(env, LCT_DT_THREAD);
00349                         if (rc) {
00350                                 OBD_FREE_PTR(env);
00351                                 lqe_putref(lqe);
00352                                 break;
00353                         }
00354 
00355                         rc = qsd_adjust(env, lqe);
00356 
00357                         lu_env_fini(env);
00358                         OBD_FREE_PTR(env);
00359                 }
00360 
00361                 /* release lqe reference grabbed by qsd_id_ast_data_get() */
00362                 lqe_putref(lqe);
00363                 break;
00364         }
00365         default:
00366                 LASSERTF(0, "invalid flags for blocking ast %d\n", flag);
00367         }
00368 
00369         RETURN(rc);
00370 }
00371 
00372 /*
00373  * Glimpse callback handler for per-ID quota locks.
00374  *
00375  * \param lock - is the lock targeted by the glimpse
00376  * \param data - is a pointer to the glimpse ptlrpc request
00377  */
00378 static int qsd_id_glimpse_ast(struct ldlm_lock *lock, void *data)
00379 {
00380         struct ptlrpc_request           *req = data;
00381         struct lquota_entry             *lqe;
00382         struct qsd_instance             *qsd;
00383         struct ldlm_gl_lquota_desc      *desc;
00384         struct lquota_lvb               *lvb;
00385         int                              rc;
00386         bool                             wakeup = false;
00387         ENTRY;
00388 
00389         rc = qsd_common_glimpse_ast(req, &desc, (void **)&lvb);
00390         if (rc)
00391                 GOTO(out, rc);
00392 
00393         lqe = qsd_id_ast_data_get(lock, false);
00394         if (lqe == NULL)
00395                 /* valid race */
00396                 GOTO(out, rc = -ELDLM_NO_LOCK_DATA);
00397 
00398         LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "glimpse on quota locks, new qunit:"LPU64,
00399                      desc->gl_qunit);
00400 
00401         qsd = lqe2qqi(lqe)->qqi_qsd;
00402 
00403         lqe_write_lock(lqe);
00404         lvb->lvb_id_rel = 0;
00405         if (desc->gl_qunit != 0 && desc->gl_qunit != lqe->lqe_qunit) {
00406                 long long space;
00407 
00408                 /* extract new qunit from glimpse request */
00409                 qsd_set_qunit(lqe, desc->gl_qunit);
00410 
00411                 space  = lqe->lqe_granted - lqe->lqe_pending_rel;
00412                 space -= lqe->lqe_usage;
00413                 space -= lqe->lqe_pending_write + lqe->lqe_waiting_write;
00414                 space -= lqe->lqe_qunit;
00415 
00416                 if (space > 0) {
00417                         if (lqe->lqe_pending_req > 0) {
00418                                 LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "request in flight, postpone "
00419                                              "release of "LPD64, space);
00420                                 lvb->lvb_id_may_rel = space;
00421                         } else {
00422                                 lqe->lqe_pending_req++;
00423 
00424                                 /* release quota space in glimpse reply */
00425                                 LQUOTA_DEBUG(lqe, "releasing "LPD64, space);
00426                                 lqe->lqe_granted -= space;
00427                                 lvb->lvb_id_rel   = space;
00428 
00429                                 lqe_write_unlock(lqe);
00430                                 /* change the lqe_granted */
00431                                 qsd_upd_schedule(lqe2qqi(lqe), lqe, &lqe->lqe_id,
00432                                                  (union lquota_rec *)&lqe->lqe_granted,
00433                                                  0, false);
00434                                 lqe_write_lock(lqe);
00435 
00436                                 lqe->lqe_pending_req--;
00437                                 wakeup = true;
00438                         }
00439                 }
00440         }
00441 
00442         qsd_set_edquot(lqe, !!(desc->gl_flags & LQUOTA_FL_EDQUOT));
00443         lqe_write_unlock(lqe);
00444 
00445         if (wakeup)
00446                 wake_up_all(&lqe->lqe_waiters);
00447         lqe_putref(lqe);
00448 out:
00449         req->rq_status = rc;
00450         RETURN(rc);
00451 }
00452 
00462 int qsd_id_lock_match(struct lustre_handle *lockh, struct lustre_handle *rlockh)
00463 {
00464         struct ldlm_lock        *lock;
00465         int                      rc;
00466         ENTRY;
00467 
00468         LASSERT(lockh);
00469 
00470         if (!lustre_handle_is_used(lockh))
00471                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00472 
00473         rc = ldlm_lock_addref_try(lockh, qsd_id_einfo.ei_mode);
00474         if (rc)
00475                 RETURN(-ENOENT);
00476 
00477         LASSERT(lustre_handle_is_used(lockh));
00478         ldlm_lock_dump_handle(D_QUOTA, lockh);
00479 
00480         if (rlockh == NULL)
00481                 /* caller not interested in remote handle */
00482                 RETURN(0);
00483 
00484         /* look up lock associated with local handle and extract remote handle
00485          * to be packed in quota request */
00486         lock = ldlm_handle2lock(lockh);
00487         LASSERT(lock != NULL);
00488         lustre_handle_copy(rlockh, &lock->l_remote_handle);
00489         LDLM_LOCK_PUT(lock);
00490 
00491         RETURN(0);
00492 }
00493 
00494 int qsd_id_lock_cancel(const struct lu_env *env, struct lquota_entry *lqe)
00495 {
00496         struct qsd_thread_info  *qti = qsd_info(env);
00497         int                      rc;
00498         ENTRY;
00499 
00500         lqe_write_lock(lqe);
00501         if (lqe->lqe_pending_write || lqe->lqe_waiting_write ||
00502             lqe->lqe_usage || lqe->lqe_granted) {
00503                 lqe_write_unlock(lqe);
00504                 RETURN(0);
00505         }
00506 
00507         lustre_handle_copy(&qti->qti_lockh, &lqe->lqe_lockh);
00508         if (lustre_handle_is_used(&qti->qti_lockh)) {
00509                 memset(&lqe->lqe_lockh, 0, sizeof(lqe->lqe_lockh));
00510                 qsd_set_qunit(lqe, 0);
00511                 qsd_set_edquot(lqe, false);
00512         }
00513         lqe_write_unlock(lqe);
00514 
00515         rc = qsd_id_lock_match(&qti->qti_lockh, NULL);
00516         if (rc)
00517                 RETURN(rc);
00518 
00519         ldlm_lock_decref_and_cancel(&qti->qti_lockh, qsd_id_einfo.ei_mode);
00520         RETURN(0);
00521 }
